segment.source: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions (Windows 10)
segment.target: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions (Windows 10)

segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.

segment.source: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions
segment.target: Creating and Editing Issues and Solutions

segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions for adding and editing application compatibility issues and solutions.

segment.source: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Your issue and solution data can be uploaded to Microsoft through the Microsoft® Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can enter information about the compatibility issues that you discover.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can enter information about the compatibility issues that you discover.

segment.source: If you find your own solutions to compatibility issues, you can enter the solutions in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).
segment.target: If you find your own solutions to compatibility issues, you can enter the solutions in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM).

segment.source: You can use the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to upload solutions to Microsoft Corporation.
segment.target: You can use the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange to upload solutions to Microsoft Corporation.

segment.source: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.
segment.target: You can use Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to flag issues as resolved.

segment.source: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.
segment.target: Resolving an issue changes the status of the issue from a red x to a green check mark on your report and report detail screens.
